conclusion: Analyze the paths of the liquids from points A, B, C, and D to determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into.
The liquid flows down from A and encounters the pink baffle.
The liquid from A is directed towards the right side of the image.
The liquid from A continues down and flows into container F.
The liquid flows down from B and encounters the light blue baffle.
The liquid from B is directed towards the left side of the image.
The liquid from B continues down and flows into container E.
The liquid flows down from C and encounters the green baffle.
The liquid from C is directed towards the right side of the image.
The liquid from C continues down and flows into container F.
The liquid flows down from D and encounters the white baffle.
The liquid from D is directed towards the left side of the image.
The liquid from D continues down and flows into container E.
Liquids from A and C flow into container F.
Liquids from B and D flow into container E.
Final Answer: Liquid from A and C will flow into container F. Liquid from B and D will flow into container E.
